result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul A. Balbach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 9:04am [mo]
[Scheduled for FSSC today]
Defendant Paul A. Balbach in court with Attorney Nicole Schrier.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty as charged, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Mr. Balbach makes statement
Mr. Balbach rejects Probation

The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 15  days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges, for work and counseling; to be served consecutive to current sentence
--0 days credit for time already served given
--Mr. Balbach is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence and the alternate sentence, if served, with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge plus $121 subpoena fees = $564, to be added to Mr. Balbach's other case 15CT100; payment is to remain at $75 per month on the same day of month; alternative for non payment is 11 days in Jefferson Co. jail with Huber privledge consecutive to any other sentence in being. 
recess: 9:25am

Cases 15CM118 and 15CT100 called at 11:21am [mo]
Defendant Paul A. Balbach in court with Attorney Nicole Schrier.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 15CT100 [Plea & Sentencing]:
Service of Information Admitted; reading waived 

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1 Amended Criminal Complaint; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 and #3.

Sentencing arguments given by ADA Hall 
Sentencing arguments given by Attorney Schrier

On Count #1, the Court sentences the Defendant: 

--To serve   90 days   in the Jefferson County Jail, consecutive, with Huber privileges; to commence forthwith.
--Days credit for time already served: 0 days
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence and the alternate sentence, if served,with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process
--To pay fine of $600 + costs= $1694, to be paid in $75 per month installments, commencing on  July 31, 2015 and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment will result in 18 days in jail with Huber privileges, consecutive
--Revocation of drivers license for 24 months
--County alcohol and drug assessment ordered
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 24 month period  
--6 demerit points assessed

As to Case 15CM118[Inital Appearance Occured]:

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires a $500  signature bond, with conditions:
--No contact with Theresa Koch
--not to make any threats toward any person
--not to commit any acts of violence
--not to possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--to report to Jefferson Co. Sheriff's Dept. for booking
recess: 11:50am

NEXT: On Case 15CM118: (1) Pretrial Conference on May 6, 2015 at 11:20am   (2) Status Conference: May 29, 2015 at 1:15pm
